verses.verse: The way of (Is. 57:20, 21) peace they have not known, And there is no justice in their ways; (Ps. 125:5; Prov. 2:15) They have made themselves crooked paths; Whoever takes that way shall not know peace.
(Sin Confessed) Therefore justice is far from us, Nor does righteousness overtake us; (Jer. 8:15) We look for light, but there is darkness! For brightness, but we walk in blackness!
(Deut. 28:29; Job 5:14; Amos 8:9) We grope for the wall like the blind, And we grope as if we had no eyes; We stumble at noonday as at twilight; We are as dead men in desolate places.
We all growl like bears, And (Is. 38:14; Ezek. 7:16) moan sadly like doves; We look for justice, but there is none; For salvation, but it is far from us.
For our (Is. 24:5; 58:1) transgressions are multiplied before You, And our sins testify against us; For our transgressions are with us, And as for our iniquities, we know them:
In transgressing and lying against the LORD, And departing from our God, Speaking oppression and revolt, Conceiving and uttering (Matt. 12:34) from the heart words of falsehood.
Justice is turned back, And righteousness stands afar off; For truth is fallen in the street, And equity cannot enter.
So truth fails, And he who departs from evil makes himself a (Is. 5:23; 10:2; 29:21; 32:7) prey. Then the LORD saw it, and it displeased Him That there was no justice.

(The Redeemer of Zion) (Is. 41:28; 63:5; 64:7; Ezek. 22:30) He saw that there was no man, And (Mark 6:6) wondered that there was no intercessor; (Ps. 98:1; Is. 63:5) Therefore His own arm brought salvation for Him; And His own righteousness, it sustained Him.
(Eph. 6:14, 17; 1 Thess. 5:8) For He put on righteousness as a breastplate, And a helmet of salvation on His head; He put on the garments of vengeance for clothing, And was clad with zeal as a cloak.
(Is. 63:6; Rom. 2:6) According to their deeds, accordingly He will repay, Fury to His adversaries, Recompense to His enemies; The coastlands He will fully repay.

(Ps. 113:3; Mal. 1:11) So shall they fear The name of the LORD from the west, And His glory from the rising of the sun; When the enemy comes in (Rev. 12:15) like a flood, The Spirit of the LORD will lift up a standard against him.
“The (Rom. 11:26) Redeemer will come to Zion, And to those who turn from transgression in Jacob,” Says the LORD.

“As ((Heb. 8:10; 10:16)) for Me,” says the LORD, “this is My covenant with them: My Spirit who is upon you, and My words which I have put in your mouth, shall not depart from your mouth, nor from the mouth of your descendants, nor from the mouth of your descendants’ descendants,” says the LORD, “from this time and forevermore.”
(The Gentiles Bless Zion) Arise, (Eph. 5:14) shine; For your light has come! And (Mal. 4:2) the glory of the LORD is risen upon you.
For behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, And deep darkness the people; But the LORD will arise over you, And His glory will be seen upon you.
The (Is. 49:6, 23; Rev. 21:24) Gentiles shall come to your light, And kings to the brightness of your rising.
“Lift (Is. 49:18) up your eyes all around, and see: They all gather together, (Is. 49:20-22) they come to you; Your sons shall come from afar, And your daughters shall be nursed at your side.
Then you shall see and become radiant, And your heart shall swell with joy; Because ((Rom. 11:25-27)) the abundance of the sea shall be turned to you, The wealth of the Gentiles shall come to you.

The multitude of camels shall cover your land, The dromedaries of Midian and (Gen. 25:4) Ephah; All those from (Gen. 25:3; Ps. 72:10) Sheba shall come; They shall bring (Is. 61:6; Matt. 2:11) gold and incense, And they shall proclaim the praises of the LORD.

All the flocks of (Gen. 25:13) Kedar shall be gathered together to you, The rams of Nebaioth shall minister to you; They shall ascend with (Is. 56:7) acceptance on My altar, And (Is. 60:13; Hag. 2:7, 9) I will glorify the house of My glory.
“Who are these who fly like a cloud, And like doves to their roosts?
